physical_appearance: "The image shows a colour transparency. ""Kodachrome Transparency"" is stated at the top. ""Processed by Kodak"" is stated at the bottom. The image shows a lady. She has short hair and adorns an ethnic costume. She is leaning against a mid-length wall and there is a potted plant beside her. The background shows buildings."
sgcool_label_text:
This Kodachrome colour transparency shows a lady in sarong kebaya. 

Kodachrome was a colour film introduced by the Eastman Kodak company in 1935. Its manufacture was discontinued in 2009, and processing ended in 2010.
title_text: Kodachrome transparency of a lady in sarong kebaya
subject_terms_1: portraits women (female humans) folk costume Peranakan
subject_terms_2: Photography Portrait photography Women Ethnic costume
